questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

You are managing a custom model through its lifecycle in AI Builder.

You need to determine the earliest status the model should be in to perform actions.

What is the earliest status required for each action? To answer, drag the appropriate statuses to the correct actions. Each status may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
correct
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/ai-builder/train-model

Trained - Test the performance of the model: You can test the performance of the model after it has been trained on the data you provided. You can see the model metrics, such as accuracy, precision, recall, and F1 score, and evaluate how well the model performs on different scenarios.

Published - Use the model in Power Apps and Power Automate: You can use the model in Power Apps and Power Automate after it has been published. Publishing a model makes it available for prediction in your apps and flows. You can also share the model with other users in your environment.

Draft - Build the model and add data: You can build the model and add data when the model is in the draft state. This is the initial state of the model when you create it. You can choose the model type, name the model, and upload or select the data you want to use for training.

Trained 
Published
Draft

Trained
Published
Trained

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
A company uses Dynamics 365 Sales.
You have the following requirements:
* View analytics on accounts.
* The model-driven app must automatically send an approval form to a manager when the purchase price is greater than $10,000.
* Create a chatbot for the webpage to interact with customer questions.
You must use Microsoft Power Platform to extend the capabilities of Dynamics 365 Sales.
You need to select an application for each requirement.
Which application should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate application to the correct requirement. Each application may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
Box 1: Power BI -
You can configure Customer Service Analytics dashboards in Power BI.

Box 2: Power Automate -
Power Automate, Trigger a cloud flow based on email properties.
Use the When a new email arrives (V3) trigger to create a cloud flow that runs when one or more of the following email properties match criteria that you provide.

Box 3: Power Virtual Agents -
Power Virtual Agents lets you create powerful AI-powered chatbots for a range of requests◊í‚Ç¨"from providing simple answers to common questions to resolving issues requiring complex conversations.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-service/configure-customer-service-analytics-dashboard https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-virtual-agents/fundamentals-what-is-power-virtual-agents https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-automate/email-triggers

questions.question_text:
A company stores its customer warranty information in Microsoft Dataverse.

Authenticated and authorized customers must be able to access their own warranty information without requiring a user-assigned Microsoft Power Platform license.

You need to share warranty information with these customers.

What should you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Power Pages site:
No User-Assigned Power Platform License Required(authenticated and authorized customers can access the warranty information without the need for a specific license).
Customizable User Interface(You can design the page to display warranty information).
Security and Authorization (You can set up authentication and authorization mechanisms within Power Pages to ensure that only authenticated and authorized customers can access the warranty information)
Integration with Dataverse.

Selected Answer: C
C - 
Based on the requirements mentioned in the question, the best option would be to use a Power Pages site, as it allows authenticated and authorized customers to access their warranty information without requiring a user-assigned Microsoft Power Platform license.

Selected Answer: ABE
The three use cases for AI Builder are:

A. Prediction
B. Object detection
E. Category classification

Selected Answer: ABE
Went A,B,E - Anomaly detection is a valid option but given anomalies are far smaller, the category classification is a higher benefit for the Organisation

questions.question_text:
A company is considering using AI Builder to gain insights into its data.

You need to determine whether the use cases for AI Builder meet the company's requirements.

What are three use cases for AI Builder? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

You are creating a self-service solution to handle incoming sales support calls.

The solution must detect the caller's location and translate any information the caller provides from the caller's native language to English.

Which two components should you use? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.D: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Remote Assist for mobile

discussion.content:
AI Builder Langauge Detection is useful but for reading text, whereas this is a call. I would say 

Azure cognitive Services to interpret and then Power virtual agents to display information back.

comments.content: "Each corect answer presents part of the solution", You do a speech-to-text using Azure cognitive Services and then translate using AI Builder Langauge Detection?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
AI Builder Language Detection Model (detect but no translation - Text Translation prebuilt AI model needed).
Each correct answer presents part of the solution, so:
- Power Virtual Agents for interaction with the caller. 
- Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services for detecting the caller's location and translating the information.

comments.content:
This answers seem to be better.
B. Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services - translation
C. AI Builder Language Detection Model - to identify the language in which the caller is communicating

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B - Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services is a set of cloud-based APIs that you can use in AI applications and data flows. It provides pretrained models that are ready to use in your applications, requiring no data and no model training on your part. 
C - AI Builder Language Detection Model is a prebuilt model that identifies the predominant language of a text document. The model analyzes the text and returns the detected language and a numeric score from 0 through 1. Scores close to 1 indicate higher confidence in the result. You can use this model to detect the caller‚Äôs location based on the language they speak.
